title: New York Manufacturing Edges Down in September
text:
By Patrick Thomas

New York manufacturers reported the pace of activity slowed in September from the previous month as optimism about business conditions over the next six months waned.

The Empire State Manufacturing Survey's general business conditions index, compiled by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, was 2.0 in September, down from a 4.8 recording in August and 4.3 in July. A positive index reading means activity is expanding.

Economists polled by The Wall Street Journal expected an index reading of 3.0.

The New York Fed said 27% of respondents reported business conditions improved from a month earlier while 25% said they had worsened.

The new orders index fell three points to 3.5 and the shipments index fell four points to 5.8, its lowest level in nearly three years.

Manufacturers were less optimistic about the coming months as the index for future business conditions fell 12 points to 13.7. The indexes for future new orders and shipments also moved lower, the report said.
